libshapedraw.internal

Class LSDUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • libshapedraw.internal.LSDUtil

extends java.lang.Object
    Internal class. Miscellaneous general-purpose utility classes and methods.

      • createTempDirectory

        public static java.io.File createTempDirectory(java.lang.String prefix)
        Create a uniquely-named temporary directory. This does essentially the same thing as java.nio.file.Files#createTempDirectory, which we can't use because it's a Java 7+ feature. Many Minecraft users are still on Java 6.

      • getUrlContents

        public static java.lang.String getUrlContents(java.net.URL url)
        Attempt to retrieve the contents at the specified URL as a UTF8-encoded, newline-normalized string. No special handling for redirects or other HTTP return codes; just a quick-and-dirty GET. Return null if anything breaks.

        Never invoke this method from Minecraft's main thread as this is an I/O operation that can taken an arbitrary amount of time (timeouts set to 10 seconds).

      • getFieldByType

        public static java.lang.reflect.Field getFieldByType(java.lang.Class objClass,
                                     java.lang.Class fieldType,
                                     int n)
        For getting at those pesky private and obfuscated fields.

        Caveat: this is not guaranteed to work correctly if there are more than one declared fields of the same exact type on obj.

        From Class.getDeclaredFields(): "The elements in the array returned are not sorted and are not in any particular order."

        In practice things work as expected even if there are multiple fields of the same type, but this is dependent on the JVM implementation.

        Returns:
        the nth (usually 0) field of the specified type declared by obj's class.

      • getFieldValue

        public static java.lang.Object getFieldValue(java.lang.reflect.Field field,
                             java.lang.Object obj)
        Convenience wrapper for reflecting a field, eliminating the checked exceptions.

      • setFinalField

        public static void setFinalField(java.lang.reflect.Field field,
                 java.lang.Object obj,
                 java.lang.Object value)
        Set a field's value even if it's marked as final.
